intro: Dipladenia billbergii, commonly known as the crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Passifloraceae family and is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant produces showy, colorful flowers with intricate structures, including a crown-like arrangement of filaments. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Dipladenia billbergii is popular as a ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
